articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Art Groups of Families of KPA Servicemen
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Art Groups of Families of KPA Servicemen
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed together with KPA servicepersons a performance given by the art groups of families of servicemen of KPA Unit 583 and Unit 3154 of the Korean People's Security Forces who took part in the second round of the second-term contest among art groups of families of KPA servicemen.
					 They put on the stage Kayagum ensemble "The Hearts Longing for the General", dialogic poem "We Will Meet Our Father General in Huichon", story telling and small chorus "Let Us Meet at the Front" and other colorful numbers of various genres.
					
					 Through the performance they enthusiastically sang of their worthwhile life they are leading under the care of the great brilliant commander and strikingly demonstrated the unshakable faith and will and revolutionary stamina and indomitable spirit of the families of the servicemen to devotedly safeguard the headquarters of the revolution and dedicate themselves to accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche together with their husbands.
					
					 Kim Jong Il highly appreciated the successful performance given by the members of the art groups of families of servicemen and extended thanks to them, expressing great satisfaction over the fact that they staged a splendid performance by making leaping progress on the basis of the ideological and artistic successes made in the past.
					
					 Admirable, indeed, are the spiritual world, working traits and lifestyle of the families of the servicemen as they are leading a militant life full of conviction and optimism about future, he said.
					
					 Noting that the second round of the second-term contest among art groups of families of servicemen held amid the great expectation and concern of the army and people strikingly demonstrated the validity and vitality of the WPK's  literary and art policy on popularizing arts and the laudable feature of the new culture created in the Songun era, he extended high appreciation and warm salute to all of them who greatly contributed to making the revolutionary spirit prevail throughout the society by participating in the contest with extraordinary enthusiasm.
					
					 He put forward important tasks which would serve as guidelines for further developing the popular and mass-based performing activities, saying that the contest among art groups of families of servicemen that came into being in the Songun era has served as a powerful engine greatly encouraging the servicepersons and people in the drive for building a great prosperous and powerful nation for its great vitality.
					
					 Among the audience were KPA General Ri Yong Ho, chief of the General Staff of the KPA, KPA General Kim Jong Gak, first vice director of the KPA General Political Bureau, KPA Generals Kim Won Hong and Hyon Chol Hae and Col. General Han Tong Gun and other commanding officers of the KPA, Secretary of the WPK Central Committee Kim Ki Nam, Department Directors of the WPK Central Committee Jang Song Thaek and Pak Nam Gi and other senior officials of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Industrial Establishments in Tanchon City
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Industrial Establishments in Tanchon City
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to industrial establishments in Tanchon City.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Tanchon Magnesia Factory.
					
					 He looked round the monument to the on-the-spot guidance provided by President Kim Il Sung and the room dedicated to the history of the factory.
					
					 Recollecting with deep emotion the shining path covered by the factory, he said that the factory has turned into a large comprehensive refractory production base under the wise leadership and meticulous care of the President, adding that his immortal revolutionary exploits would shine long in the history of the country.
					
					 He acquainted himself with the technical equipment and production at the factory, going round the melting shop and other production processes. 
					
					 He highly praised the workers of the factory for their achievements made in the past, expressing great satisfaction over the fact that they have steadily increased the production of quality magnesia clinker through their tenacious efforts, always bearing deep in mind the President's last instructions on developing the Juche-based magnesia clinker industry in a big way, and thus made a great contribution to the development of the nation's industry and put the production of magnesia clinker on a Juche basis, in particular.
					
					 The magnesia clinker industry in the DPRK established by the President has a very bright prospect of development as it is based on inexhaustible raw materials and resources, high technology and rich experience, he noted, underscoring the need to continue intensifying scientific researches into this field, meticulously organize the production and boost the production of a variety of refractory and light burned magnesia.
					
					 The second leg of his guidance was the Tanchon Smeltery reconstructed on a modern basis.
					
					 After being briefed on the technological issues solved by the smeltery by itself, he went round the combined production control room and other places to learn about the production there in detail.
					
					 He highly praised its workers for their feats, expressing great satisfaction over the fact that they have made remarkable technological progress through a brisk technical innovation movement in the wake of their successful construction of the ultra-modern smeltery.
					
					 The above-said smeltery which made a definite breakthrough towards the increased production by steadily developing technology is a model smeltery in terms of science and technology, he said, adding that its eye-opening change is a powerful demonstration of the validity and vitality of the WPK's policy on the technical revolution.
					
					 He set forth tasks to be fulfilled by the smeltery, stressing that it has an important role to play in building an economic power.
					
					 The last leg of his guidance was the Tanchon Mining Machine Plant.
					
					 After being briefed on the plant before a huge painting showing a panoramic view of the plant, he made the rounds of the large processing shop, the indoor sheet metal processing shop and other production processes and newly built cosy-looking cultural and welfare service facilities to learn about construction and technological equipment there in detail.
					
					 The workers of the plant have successfully carried out its modernization by displaying the same spirit and stamina as done when producing a lot of machine tools with empty hands in the difficult postwar period, he noted, emphasizing that this fully reflected the revolutionary spirit of the workers of the DPRK, the fighters who devotedly implement even the task of flattening a high mountain at one go, if required by the Party.
					
					 Noting that the modern factories and enterprises built in Tanchon City are a miniature showing the proud appearance of the Juche-based industry which is witnessing an overall technological updating based on ultra-modern technology, he stressed that the DPRK is winning one victory after another, undeterred by any worldwide economic fluctuation and the drive for building a thriving nation is sure to win as it has a strong industrial foundation of Korean style.
					
					 He was accompanied by Secretary Kim Ki Nam and Department Directors Pak Nam Gi and Jang Song Thaek of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Hyong Jik
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Hyong Jik
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were placed before the statue and the grave of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea, in Ponghwa-ri, Kangdong County, and Mangyongdae in Pyongyang on Friday on the occasion of the 83rd anniversary of his death.
					 Seen before the statue and the grave were wreaths from Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were Kim Il Chol, Yang Hyong Sop, Choe Yong Rim and officials of party and power organs, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons and working people and school youth and children in the city.
					
					 Laid before the statue and the grave were wreaths in the name of the WPK Central Committee and the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 Then placed were wreaths in the name of ministries, national institutions, revolutionary schools, educational institutions and party and power bodies, enterprises, farms and schools in the city and bouquets.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to Kim Hyong Jik who performed undying feats for the Korean people's cause of national liberation and independence against imperialism.
					
					 Wreaths and bouquets were also laid before his statues at Kim Hyong Jik Military Medical University and in Sakju County, North Phyongan Province, and Junggang County, Jagang Province.

articles.title: Great Life of Kim Hyong Jik
articles.content:
Great Life of Kim Hyong Jik
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Korean people are recollecting with deep emotion the great life of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter, shining with the idea of Jiwon (Aim High) on the occasion of his death anniversary (June 5).
					 Having keenly experienced the grim realities of the country and the miserable plight of the fellow-countrymen groaning under the military jackboots of the Japanese imperialists, he put forward the great idea Aim High in his early years to indicate a new path to be followed by the Korean independence movement.
					
					 Aim High illuminated the correct fighting target and way for the Korean nation to achieve the independence of the country by its own efforts. It was a thorough-going revolutionary idea reflecting the people's wish for building a new society and a guideline for forcefully propelling the development of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement.
					
					 He took the idea of Aim High as his goal of life and struggle and thoroughly applied it in the whole course of his revolutionary activities.
					
					 He showed his outstanding organizational ability as a leader of the student movement while attending Sungsil Middle School. He unremittingly waged activities for enlightening masses and winning comrades and formed the Korean National Association in March Juche 6 (1917).
					
					 He, who conceived a new orientation for the development of the national liberation movement, advanced a policy of shifting the anti-Japanese national liberation movement from nationalist movement to proletarian revolution at the Kuandian Meeting in August 1919.
					
					 He established schools and night schools everywhere he went under the difficult conditions of underground struggle and devoted all his sincerity to educating the young people in the spirit of national independence and anti-Japanese patriotic idea.
					
					 It was precious exploits performed by Kim Hyong Jik for the country and people, the times and history that he brought up the members of revolutionary Mangyongdae family to be ardent patriots and great revolutionaries who devoted themselves to the country and people.
					
					 He sent President Kim Il Sung, his 11-year-old son on one thousand-ri journey alone. This fact still moves all the people as a revolutionary legend of the revolutionary Mangyongdae family.
					
					 His unswerving will and mettle to achieve the country's independence without fail by fighting down through generations is vivid in every verse of the poem "The Green Pine on Nam Hill" written by him.
					
					 An eternal song of faith, the poem is powerfully inspiring the army and people of Korea to the heroic struggle and feats.
					
					 Indeed, the idea of Aim High of Kim Hyong Jik who walked the untrodden path of history is being carried forward generation after generation, century after century.

articles.title: Greetings to King of Sweden
articles.content:
Greetings to King of Sweden
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to King Carl ⅩⅥ Gustaf of Sweden on the occasion of its national day.
					Kim in the message wished for prosperity to Sweden, extending congratulations to its king and people.

articles.title: Chinese Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Chinese Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Liu Xiaoming and staff members of the Chinese embassy here gave helping hands to the DPRK-China Friendship Thaekam Co-op Farm in Sunan District, Pyongyang, on Friday.
					 They helped farmers in transplanting rice and talked with farm officials, deepening friendship.
					
					 Noting that President Hu Jintao and General Secretary Kim Jong Il declared as a "year of China-DPRK friendship" this year marking the 60th anniversary of the establishment of bilateral diplomatic relations, the ambassador called for building more beautiful future of the cooperative relations between the two countries as intended by their top leaders.
					
					 The Korean people are waging the dynamic drive to open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation in 2012 under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, he said, hoping that the farm would gain great success in agricultural production for this year.
					
					 The staff members of the embassy handed farming materials to the farm.

articles.title: Inter-provincial Sports Contest Opened
articles.content:
Inter-provincial Sports Contest Opened
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- A national sports contest among provincial teams was opened.
					 The contest involves such events as football, marathon, boxing, weightlifting and judo in Hamhung of South Hamgyong Province, Hyesan of Ryanggang Province and other places of the country.
					
					 Its opening ceremony took place at the Hamhung Stadium Friday.

articles.title: World Environment Day Marked
articles.content:
World Environment Day Marked
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The World Environment Day (June 5) was observed in the DPRK.
					 A symposium on rural energy and climate change was held in Unha-ri, Unjon County, North Phyongan Province, under the sponsorship of the Pyongyang International Information of New Technology and Economy Center (PIINTEC).
					
					 Addressing the symposium, the director of the PIINTEC said that today the global environmental protection is raised as a matter of concern common to the humankind. It is a pressing task to prevent ecological destruction and natural disasters which are getting worse day by day due to the climate change, especially global warming caused by the greenhouse gas emission, he stressed.
					
					 He noted that the further the society and economy develop, the more important the environmental protection becomes, emphasizing that the government's policy of protecting environment should be implemented to the letter to bring about a turn in this undertaking.
					
					 Meanwhile, a photo exhibition and composition contest on the theme "Future of Our Planet" were held in the Pyongyang Students and Children's Palace. 
					
					 The participants looked round the photos showing the beautiful natural environment of Korea and natural disasters in the world caused by the global warming before the composition contest.

articles.title: Visitors to Revolutionary Museum Increase
articles.content:
Visitors to Revolutionary Museum Increase
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Junggang Revolutionary Museum in Jagang Province of the DPRK is visited everyday by servicepersons, working people of different circles and school youth and children.
					 On display at the museum are historic data and relics on the revolutionary activities Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and an outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea, conducted while staying in Junggang from December Juche 7 (1918) to the fall of the next year.
					
					Visitors to it are increasing in number in June, at least 1,000 on a daily average.
					
					 They laid floral baskets, bouquets and flowers before the statue of Kim Hyong Jik at the Junggang Revolutionary Site.
					
					 Then they looked round the museum, recalling with deep emotion the undying feats of Kim Hyong Jik who dedicated his all to the liberation of the country and freedom and happiness of the people.

articles.title: Traitor Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Remarks Refuted
articles.content:
Traitor Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Remarks Refuted
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Lee Myung Bak of south Korea, in his "speech on radio" Monday, viciously slandered the DPRK's nuclear activities for self-defense as "shock" and "threat to peace." And he revealed the wicked intention to zealously cooperate with the U.S. and other foreign forces, while clamoring for "perfect readiness for security."
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday in a signed commentary denounces such behavior as one more grave provocation to the DPRK and an unpardonable declaration of confrontation with it.
					
					 The commentary says:
					
					 Lee blindly took issue with the DPRK's measure to bolster up its nuclear deterrent. Such absurd deed can be done only by idiots who do not know the essence of the present situation and by whom the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula have been preserved.
					
					 The DPRK's measure for bolstering up the nuclear deterrent is an inevitable result of the anti-DPRK moves escalated by the U.S. with each passing day.
					
					 Peace has been kept so far on the Korean Peninsula, the most unstable hotspot in the world. This is attributable to the DPRK which has bolstered up its nuclear deterrent for self-defense to cope with such intensified U.S. war moves of aggression. 
					
					 Nevertheless, Lee has parroted his master's assertion that the U.S. "nuclear umbrella" is "protecting" south Korea. This is a shameless and reckless action of distorting the reality.
					
					 As for the "period of mourning" uttered by him, it was caused by his group itself. The south Korean public unanimously contends that the unexpected and tragic death of the former "president" is murder by Lee Myung Bak's political retaliation.
					
					 As long as traitor Lee is allowed to let loose a spate of futile outbursts against the DPRK with his sinister ambition, the prospect of the inter-Korean relations will be getting gloomier and the DPRK's will to get through with the group of traitors will be further hardened. After all, the group will face a disgraceful destruction.

articles.title: U.S. Policy to Dominate Eurasia Censured
articles.content:
U.S. Policy to Dominate Eurasia Censured
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The U.S. policy to dominate Eurasia is bound to go bankrupt as it is the one against independence, peace and history.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 The article cites facts that the above-said policy of the U.S. that started in the mid-19th century got pronounced after it divided Korea into two parts and drew the demarcation line for the Cold War in Europe at the end of World War II and the policy has entered a full-fledged phase since the demise of the Cold War. 
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The defeat of the U.S. imperialists in the Korean war in the 1950s shattered the myth of their "mightiness" and started them on the downgrade. 
					
					 In the subsequent period the U.S. sustained a defeat in the Vietnam war, too, suffering disgrace and shame again in the eyes of the world.
					
					 The U.S. started wars in Afghanistan and Iraq in the new century and hastily declared "victory" in the wars but it still finds itself in an inescapable quagmire.
					
					 To make the matters worse, it is in the grip of unprecedented "financial crisis."
					
					 The U.S has become so weak politically, economically and militarily that it is hard for it to maintain its position as the world's "only superpower."
					
					 The end of the U.S. is not only expected but is becoming a reality.
					
					It is the inevitability of history and a matter of time for the U.S. policy for dominating Eurasia to go bust.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to face up to the changed reality and roll back the above-said policy, urges the article.

articles.title: DPRK's Efforts for Combating Climate Change
articles.content:
DPRK's Efforts for Combating Climate Change
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The climate change is now posing a great menace to the human existence.
					The United Nations Environment Programme set forth the theme "Your planet needs you! Unite to combat climate change!" for this year and called upon all the countries to turn out in the drive for combating the climate change.
					
					 Jong Yong Nam, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Nature Conservation Union of Korea, said in an interview with KCNA on the occasion of the World Environment Day (June 5) that the DPRK has set the prevention of the climate change as an important state policy and taken substantial measures for it since it entered the "United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change", and continued:
					
					 Great efforts have been directed to restoring the forests destroyed owing to the climate change.
					
					 The DPRK set the entire people in motion to strictly ban the illegal deforestation and to cover the whole country with forests.
					
					 At the same time, it also concentrated much effort on building minor hydro-power stations which have no impact on the climate change, thus creating lots of hydro-power generating bases.
					
					 While taking state measures for reducing greenhouse gas emission by fossil fuel, it is encouraging the efforts for introducing newly-developed alternative energy technologies.
					
					 New energy technologies which can lower coal consumption and raise efficiency are developed and introduced into thermal power plants and industrial establishments.
					
					 Along with this, efforts are being made to introduce methane gas into rural villages for meeting the demand for energy and to develop and apply various recycling energy technologies such as wind power and solar heat to suit the characteristics of areas.
					
					 Meanwhile, it is energetically pushing ahead with the international cooperation for combating the climate change.
					
					 It is carrying on projects for solving the acute food problem caused by the climate change in contact with the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations.
					
					 In the future, too, our country will perform its duty assigned by the framework convention by further strengthening the international cooperation for combating the climate change.
					
					 To observe the day, a national symposium and other colorful functions for combating the climate change were held in Pyongyang and local areas.

articles.title: World Environment Day Observed
articles.content:
World Environment Day Observed
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- All countries should pay attention to the serious problem of climate change in the world and address it by their concerted efforts. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday urges this in a signed article devoted to World Environment Day.
					
					 It says:
					
					 The climate change resulting from the global warming is one of the biggest problems facing all the countries in the world at present. 
					
					 The reality shows that it is possible to settle the problem only when all the people in the world regard it as a crisis before each of them and roll up their sleeves to weather it. 
					
					 No country can be an exception as far as the work to protect the global environment is concerned. 
					
					 It is possible to achieve good success only when all the countries deeply understand the urgency and importance of the work and make positive efforts to carry it out. 
					
					 Greeting World Environment Day, the DPRK is briskly conducting a variety of work to cope with the climate change and protect environment under the state and social care. It is boosting the international cooperation in this field.
					
					 Great progress will be made in this field when all countries in the world unite and make concerted efforts to cope with the climate change and protect the global environment.

articles.title: Full Display of Revolutionary Soldier Spirit Called for
articles.content:
Full Display of Revolutionary Soldier Spirit Called for
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The revolutionary soldier spirit created by the Korean People's Army serves as ideological and moral pabulum to make people strong in ideology and faith.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a signed article.
					
					 The revolutionary soldier spirit is a noble revolutionary spirit of the KPA the keynote of which is the spirit of devotedly safeguarding the leader, the spirit of devotedly carrying through his orders and the heroic self-sacrificing spirit, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 This spirit, first of all, serves as a source of the ideological and moral power which helps the army and people in the DPRK fully display loyalty to the leader.
					
					 Hero Kil Yong Jo unhesitatingly chose to blow himself up for the safety of the headquarters of the revolution and heroic soldiers laid down their lives to protect the revolutionary slogans written on the barked trees on Mujae Peak from raging flames. These feats clearly bespeak that the revolutionary soldier spirit of the KPA has turned the whole army into the elite ranks devotedly defending the leader.
					
					 The revolutionary soldier spirit serves as precious ideological and moral pabulum which prepares all the people to be fighters for bold offensives who do not know impossibility.
					
					 The army and people have paved a wide avenue for building a thriving nation over the past more than decade while defending socialism in the worst adversity under the uplifted banner of Songun. 
					
					 The revolutionary soldier spirit is just the great spirit which brought about historic miracles to be always recorded in the history of the country.
					
					 The above-mentioned spirit serves as ideological and moral pabulum which helps all the people to become revolutionaries in the Songun era possessed of transparent working class consciousness.
					
					 There were soldiers of the KPA and workers who courageously struggled against the enemies, remaining true to their constancies as revolutionary soldiers after being adrift in the sea to find themselves in the enemy-held areas, and finally succeeded in coming back to the care of leader Kim Jong Il. Their heroic deeds go to prove that everybody can emerge a victor in the anti-imperialist class struggle when fully equipped with the above-said spirit.

articles.title: Warmongers' Moves for War of Aggression Slammed
articles.content:
Warmongers' Moves for War of Aggression Slammed
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) on June 2 issued an appeal calling on the Koreans to foil the warmongers' war moves by their concerted efforts. 
					 The appeal recalled that the Lee Myung Bak dictatorial regime has frantically pursued confrontation with the DPRK since it came to power, totally denying the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, adding that, not content with this, it officially announced south Korea's full participation in the PSI under the pretext of the north's underground nuclear test recently. 
					
					 The underground nuclear test conducted by the north was a measure for self-defense to cope with the persistent hostile acts the U.S. and its followers have perpetrated, taking issue with its satellite launch, the appeal noted. 
					
					 It called upon all the compatriots to unite close and turn out in the struggle to foil the warmongers' war moves. 
					
					 The appeal went on:
					
					 Let us wage a decisive struggle by fully displaying the spirit of "By our nation itself" and frustrate the U.S. imperialists' war moves, drive the U.S. forces out of south Korea and achieve the independent reunification.
					
					 Let us thoroughly foil Japan's desperate bid to stage a comeback to Korea, while working hard to create a crisis on the Korean Peninsula and go without making apology and reparation for its crimes.
					
					 Let us get the people's life stabilized and win back the civic rights by forcing Lee Myung Bak to step down and having the "Grand National Party" disbanded and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration to achieve peace and prosperity. 
					
					The South Headquarters of Pomminryon will join the seventy million Koreans in their positive struggle to foil the war moves of the U.S., Japan and the Lee dictatorial regime and achieve the independent reunification.

articles.title: Puppet Prosecution's Moves to Cover up Killings of Ryongsan Evacuees Flayed
articles.content:
Puppet Prosecution's Moves to Cover up Killings of Ryongsan Evacuees Flayed
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Members of the All-People Committee for Measures against the Murder of Evacuees in Ryongsan of south Korea held press conferences outside the prosecution offices in its 16 provinces and cities at the same time on June 2 to denounce the puppet prosecution for its dastardly moves to cover up the killings of evacuees in Ryongsan.
					 Speakers at the press conferences assailed the prosecution for having failed to properly investigate any case of killings of evacuees in disregard of the people's voices demanding a probe into a lot of doubts about the cases.
					
					 They chided the prosecution for justifying the brutal violence perpetrated by police "commandoes" and gangsters of the evacuation teams after being hurled into the scenes of the sit-in strikes of evacuees in Ryongsan and defending the authorities' moves to play down and conceal the truth about the murder.
					
					 Accusing the prosecution of refusing to open to the public the records of investigation which contain important clues to the Ryongsan tragedy, they declared they would never tolerate any trial to be held on the basis of distorted results of investigation made by the prosecution.
					
					 They demanded the court turn down the prosecution's all records of investigation which falsify the truth about the case and pass a fair judgment on the evacuees.
					
					 They held that the public prosecutor general should step down as he is entirely responsible for the tragedy, urging the authorities to make an overall reinvestigation into the tragedy and release the detained evacuees without delay.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Full Participation in PSI Condemned in Switzerland
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Full Participation in PSI Condemned in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee issued a statement on May 28 to condemn the Lee Myung Bak group for having decided to fully participate in the U.S.-led PSI.
					 Saying that the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet government are coming out in full-scale confrontation with the DPRK, the statement contended that the PSI is evidently aimed at the DPRK.
					
					 Outbreak of a new war on the Korean Peninsula entirely depends on the attitude of the United States and the south Korean puppet regime, the statement said.
					
					 The Lee group's decision to fully participate in the PSI is a declaration of war against the DPRK, the statement pointed out, demanding halt to war moves against the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun refuta chisme anti-RPDC de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun refuta chisme anti-RPDC de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 5 de junio (ATCC) -- En su "discurso radial" pronunciado el pasado dia primero, Lee Myung Bak acuso siniestramente las actividades nucleares para la autodefensa de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea describiendolas como "impacto" y "amenaza a la paz".
					 Igualmente, expuso su siniestro intento de intensificar la cooperacion con las fuerzas extranjeras como EE.UU. abogando por el "perfecto estado de seguridad".
					
					  A traves de un comentario individual difundido este viernes, el diario Rodong Sinmun denuncia tal chisme de Lee calificandolo de otra provocacion severa a la RPDC e imperdonable declaracion de confrontacion con ella.
					
					 La RPDC se vio obligada a adoptar las medidas para reforzar su disuasivo nuclear porque EE.UU. intensifica cada dia mas sus maniobras hostiles a la primera.
					
					 Pese a esta realidad, Lee Myung Bak cuestiona atrevidamente tales medidas actuando como idiota que no sabe la causa esencial de la situacion actual ni quien es el que defiende la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					  Gracias al fortalecimiento del disuasivo nuclear para la autodefensa frente a las cada dia mas brutales maniobras belicas de EE.UU., se mantiene hasta ahora la paz de la Peninsula Coreana aunque es la zona candente mas inestable del mundo.
					
					  Sin embargo, Lee Myung Bak repite como papagayo la palabra de su amo norteamericano de que el "paraguas nuclear" del imperio "protege" al Sur de Corea, lo cual es una tergiversacion de la realidad.
					
					 En cuanto al "periodo de duelo" mencionado por Lee, los compinches de el son los culpables de ello. 
					
					 Pues, la opinion publica surcoreana insiste unanimemente en que el repentino y tragico fallecimiento del ex "presidente" es un asesinato producto de la represalia politica de Lee Myung Bak.
					
					 Mientras que el traidor Lee continue su chismografia anti-RPDC persiguiendo malsanas ambiciones, seran mas tenebrosas las perspectivas de las relaciones Norte-Sur y se redoblara la voluntad de la RPDC de acabar con la horda de aquel. 
					
					 Como resultado, esta camarilla sera condenada a la ruina vergonzosa.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun senala fracaso de politica de EE.UU. sobre Eurasia.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun senala fracaso de politica de EE.UU. sobre Eurasia.
 Pyongyang, 5 de junio (ATCC) -- En un articulo individual divulgado este viernes el rotativo Rodong Sinmun se refiere a que la politica de Estados Unidos de dominar a Eurasia no podra evadir sin falta la bancarrota por su caracter anti-soberania, anti-paz y anti-historia.
					  La politica de EE.UU. en cuestion se inicio a mediados del siglo XIX y despues del cese de la segunda guerra mundial, esta politica dividio la Peninsula Coreana en dos partes y engendro en Europa la guerra fria. Desde entonces EE.UU. practicaba de modo abierto su politica y despues del fin de la guerra fria recurrio freneticamente a ella, revela el articulo y continua:
					
					  La derrota de los yanquis en la guerra coreana desencadenada en la decada de 1950 hizo anicos el mito de su "supremacia" y dejo abierto el inicio de  la  decadencia a estos imperialistas.
					
					  Luego, EE.UU. fracaso tambien en la guerra vietnamita y de esta manera, volvio a sufrir la derrota vergonzosa ante faz mundial.
					
					  El imperio desato en el nuevo siglo las guerras de Afganistan y de Iraq y declaro apresuradamente su "victoria". Pero, se esfuerza desesperadamente todavia por salir de la cienaga. 
					
					  Para colmo, EE.UU  sufre la "crisis  financiera" sin precedente.
					
					  El pais norteamericano esta debilitandose en lo politico, economico y militar.
					
					  Ahora, EE.UU. se encuentra en la situacion dificil para mantener su posicion de la "unica  superpotencia" y su arruinamiento se acerca mas realmente. El fracaso de la politica de EE.UU de dominar a Eurasia es la inevitabilidad de la historia y deviene el problema del tiempo.
					
					  EE.UU. debe darse clara cuenta de la realidad cambiada y renunciar su politica en cuestion.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun llama a unir los esfuerzos frente a cambio climatico
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun llama a unir los esfuerzos frente a cambio climatico
Pyongyang, 5 de junio (ATCC) -- En el articulo individual publicado hoy con motivo del Dia Mundial del Medioambiente, el diario Rodong Sinmun llama a todos los paises a prestar la atencion al problema de cambio climatico, que amenaza seriamente al mundo, y a manejarlo con las fuerzas unidas.
					  Hoy en dia, el cambio climatico a causa del calentamiento de la Tierra es uno de los problemas mas grandes y dificiles que tienen por igual todos los paises del planeta, senala el articulista.
					
					 La realidad demuestra que ese problema puede ser resuelto cuando todos los habitantes del planeta se levanten en la detencion del cambio climatico percibiendolo como la crisis a "mi mismo", apunta.
					
					  Prosigue que cuando todos los paises, sin excepcion alguna, se esfuercen por proteger el medioambiente de la Tierra bien conscientes del caracter perentorio e importante de esta labor, se lograran buenos exitos.
					
					  Con motivo del dia mundial de medioambiente, la RPDC realiza bajo la atencion estatal y social una serie de actividades referentes al cambio climatico y la proteccion medioambiental y dinamiza la cooperacion internacional en esta rama, subraya. 
					
					  Si todos los paises unen las fuerzas y los esfuerzos por prevenir el cambio climatico y proteger el medio ambiente de la Tierra, se lograra un gran avance en este trabajo, ratifica el rotativo.

articles.title: Esfuerzos de la RPDC por prevenir el cambio climatico
articles.content:
Esfuerzos de la RPDC por prevenir el cambio climatico
Pyongyang, 5 de junio (ATCC) -- Hoy en dia, el cambio climatico amenaza seriamente las actividades de la humanidad por la subsistencia.
					  Por esta razon, el Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Medio Ambiente (PNUMA) presento este ano el tema "El planeta te demanda. !Unamonos para prevenir el cambio climatico!" y exhorto a todos los paises a trabajar para este fin.
					
					 El vicepresidente del Comite Central de la Federacion de Proteccion de la Naturaleza de Corea, Jong Yong Nam, se entrevisto con la Agencia Telegrafica Central de Corea con motivo del Dia Mundial del Medioambiente (5 de junio).
					
					 Desde que ingreso en la Convencion del Cambio Climatico de la ONU, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea viene tomando medidas sustanciales para detener ese fenomeno adverso tras formular este quehacer como una importante politica estatal, comenzo Jong y continuo:
					
					  Ante todo, el gobierno de la RPDC dio buen impulso a la rehabilitacion de las areas boscosas devastadas a causa del cambio climatico.
					
					  Todo el pueblo fue movilizado en la batalla contra la tala ilicita y en la reforestacion de todo el pais.
					
					  Ademas, se construyeron numerosas bases de generacion hidroelectrica, incluyendo las centrales de mediano y pequeno tamanos, en el principio de no influenciar sobre el polemico desastre natural.
					
					  Se adoptaron medidas estatales para reducir la emision de gases con efectos de invernaculo generados por el combustible fosil.
					
					  Igualmente, se desarrollan con afan nuevas tecnologias energeticas, que permitan disminuir el consumo de carbon y aumentar la eficiencia de combustion, para aplicarlas en las centrales termoelectricas, fabricas y empresas.
					
					 Mientras tanto, en las zonas rurales se realiza la gasificacion con el metano con la meta de cubrir las demandas energeticas.
					
					 Se desarrollan y se introducen de acuerdo con las caracteristicas regionales las tecnicas de obtencion de las energias renovables como la energia eolica y la solar.
					
					  Al mismo tiempo, se dinamiza la cooperacion con otros paises para la detencion del cambio climatico.
					
					  Para estabilizar la situacion de alimentos que escasean debido al cambio climatico, la RPDC implementa los proyectos en aras de la seguridad alimentaria junto con la Organizacion de las Naciones Unidas para la Agricultura y la Alimentacion (FAO).
					
					  La RPDC seguira intensificando la cooperacion internacional para cumplir con fidelidad sus deberes asumidos en virtud de la Convencion arriba mencionada.
					
					  De otro lado, en ocasion de dicha efemeride, tuvieron lugar en esta capital y las localidades el seminario nacional y otras variadas actividades para la prevencion del cambio climatico.
